text: {{Infobox football biography | name = Ibrahim Salah Abdel Fattah | image = | full_name = Ibrahim Salah Abdel Fattah | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1987|4|1|df=y}} | birth_place = Mansourah, Egypt | height = 1.99 m | position = Defensive Midfielder | youthyears1 = | youthclubs1 = El Mansoura | years1 = 2006–2009 | clubs1 = El Mansoura | caps1 = 42 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2009–2013 | clubs2 = Zamalek | caps2 = 73 | goals2 = 3 | years3 = 2013–2014 | clubs3 = Al-Orobah | caps3 = 17 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2014–2017 | clubs4 = Zamalek | caps4 = 54 | goals4 = 3 | years5 = 2016 | clubs5 = → Smouha (Loan) | caps5 = 17 | goals5 = 1 | years6 = 2017–2021 | clubs6 = Al Mokawloon | caps6 = 76 | goals6 = 2 | years7 = 2021–2022 | clubs7 = Ghazl El Mahalla | caps7 = 76 | goals7 = 2 | nationalyears1 = 2010– | nationalteam1 = Egypt | nationalcaps1 = 34 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | pcupdate = 12 July 2022 | ntupdate = 1 February 2017 }} Ibrahim Salah Abdel-Fattah (; born on April 1, 1987) is an Egyptian football footballer. Salah played 34 times for the Egyptian national team, scoring one goal, against Uganda in August 2013. ==References== Category:1987 births Category:Egyptian footballers Category:Living people Category:Egypt international footballers
